issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
Certificate has expired ?

     When am running my old apps in simulator and ios device am getting below error.
     
      When I run the newly created sample apps in simulator it is working fine without any problem.
    
    How to resolve it.

*{color:#333333}Error{color}:*

    {color:#333333}[ERROR]{color} : certificate has expired
    2017-10-14T05:46:30.298Z | TRACE | titanium exited with exit code 100
    2017-10-14T05:46:30.299Z | ERROR | Error: ti run exited with error code 100
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (/Users/balakrishna/.appcelerator/install/5.1.0/package/node_modules/appc-cli-titanium/plugins/run.js:92:66)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:110:17)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1074:12)
    2017-10-14T05:46:30.300Z | TRACE | Sending exit signal to titanium process: 2240

Appcelerator Command-Line version = 5.1.0
        Operating System                   = Mac OS X 10.11.4 - 64bit
        Node.js Version                   = 0.12.7
        Npm Version                       = 2.11.3
        Titanium CLI Version              = 5.0.5
        Titanium SDK Version              = 5.2.2.GA
        I have valid distributed certificate and provisioning profiles.

(/Users/balakrishna/.appcelerator/install/5.1.0/ package/node_modules/appc-cli-titanium/plugins/run.js:92:66) at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:110:17) at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1074:12) 2017-10-16T05:05:22.404Z | TRACE | Sending exit signal to titanium process: 50 Can any one help me out, How to resolve it.

Hi [~chanakya] I beleive this issue should be resolved now. However, appc cli 5.1.0 is over 1 year old now so I would recommend you upgrade if possible (the latest is 6.2.4), please note that this upgrade will bump the Alloy version from 1.7.X to 1.9.X
Hello, To update the CLI run "appc setup". Thanks.
